title: Andy Murray’s China Open run ended by Dominic Thiem
text:
Dominc Thiem was too good for Andy Murray in their China Open quarter final clash (Picture: Getty)

Andy Murray’s China Open run is over after Dominic Thiem battled to a hard-fought straight sets victory in their quarter-final clash.

Having won back-to-back ATP matches for the first time in over a year following career-saving hip surgery, Murray again gave a performance to suggest he is capable of making an, by his own admission, unlikely full recovery.

World No.5 Thiem broke in the first game of the match with a delicious drop shot and was rarely troubled on his own serve thereafter and, after breaking again early in the second set, he looked on course for a comfortable win with Murray understandably beginning to tire.

Dominic Thiem was pushed all the way by Andy Murray in their China Open quarter final (Picture: Getty)

The Austrian served for the match at 5-4 but Murray summoned up all of his fighting spirit to break back and played his best tennis of the contest to force a tie break which Thiem ultimately dominated, winning 7-3 with the contest edging towards the two hour mark.

Meanwhile, in Tokyo at the Japan Open, Novak Djokovic continued his own comeback from a shoulder setback by crushing Lucas Pouille 6-1, 6-2 in just 50 minutes.

‘It was definitely one of the best matches I’ve played this year,’ said Djokovic afterwards. ‘Best one of this week [and it] came at the right time.

‘I thought Lucas was playing really well the first couple of matches in this tournament.

‘I saw him play a couple of days ago against Nishioka and he was playing really well. I took away the time from him.

‘I served well, served many aces, returned a lot of his serves back and just used every opportunity to come in. Just overall, a really flawless performance.’
